_header: There woned in Babylon a bairn in that burgh rich
_description: ‘The Pistill of Susan’ (the story of Susannah) — twenty-eight 13-line stanzas (ababababcdddc of alliterative verse

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Þer was in in Babiloine a bern in þat borw richeÞat
                    was a Ieuȝ ientil & Ioachim he hiht…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Ihesu crist wiþ mylde steueneGrant us alle þe
                    blisse of heuene Amen.

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
ÞEr was in Babiloine a barne in þat borw richeÞat
                    was a Iueȝ gentel & Ioachim he hiht…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…God graunt vs þi grace to play vs pertly in þi
                    placeAnd feiþely þi feire face to se þat is swete
                    Amen
BLAdd22283.Attributed Title:
Here begynneþ A pistel of Susan (f. 125vb,
                    rubric)

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
…The chyue þe cholet and þe chesboke cheue The
                    chyboll þe cheueron þat chaungeth at nyght…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…In þe dayes of danyellThe wytnesse wyll well tellOf
                    þe same prophete
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Wanting stanzas 1-8 due to missing leaves at beginning of volume.
                    Nineteenth-century transcription is London,  British Library Egerton 2257, ff.
                        133-136v. Followed by ‘Explicit’ in lower margin of
                    f. 5.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Sussan (RT, by scribe); An old english poeme intitled Sussan on þe
                    Story of Susannah & þe 2 Ylders (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of
                    contents)

PierpontM818.First Lines:
Þer woned a berde in babeloyne in þat burgh richeHe was a
                    Jve gentil Joachim he hyht…
PierpontM818.Last Lines:
…Þe pystel wittenesse it wellOf þe
                    prophete
PierpontM818.Note:
Immediately after text in same hand is ‘Qui scripsit carmen sit
                    benedictus Amen’ (f. 5).

HunHM114.First Lines:
Ther was in babyloyn a biern in þat burgh richeÞat was a
                    Iewe Ientil & Ioachym he hight…
HunHM114.Last Lines:
…Þe pistil witnessiþ it wellOf þe
                    prophete
HunHM114.Attributed Title:
Here endith þe storye of Susanne and Danyell (f.
                    190v)
